fields.description:
(!) Testing Notes (!)

Q: Make sure to test opening the inline edit, making a change, and the following actions:
Clicking other inline edits (x)
Closing the epics or detail panel (x)
Switching modes (x)
Drag and Drop (x)
Create/Delete sprints (x)
Reordering epics (x)
Multi-select (x)
Opening the tools menu (x)
Applying quick/instant filters(x)
Creating a new issue (x)
Create a new epic (x)
Anything I'm missing (?)

Q: Test that foreign character's work
A: (/) UTF-8 characters work; no XSS

Q: Try long but reasonable input
A: (/) Input is limited to a reasonable length

Q: Does tab submit as well?
A: (/) Yes but does not initiate inline edit of next epic, which I think is okay

fields.description:
According to the [Count of Visible Issues Shown in Column Header on Work Mode|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/GreenHopper+6.0.5+Release+Notes?showChildren=false#GreenHopper6.0.5ReleaseNotes-CountofVisibleIssuesShowninColumnHeaderonWorkMode], the *Count of Visible Issues Shown* should appear respectively for both *Scrum* and *Kanban* board.

After testing, it only appears for *Kanban*. *Scrum* board does not show the counter.

*SCRUM*
!scrum.JPG!

*KANBAN*
!kanban.JPG!

fields.description:
COS: 
- Allow dragging of the story but make sure that the droppable area in the backlog does not indicate anything that might make the user think they were dropping the story from the sprint

(!) Testing Notes (!)

Q: Can you multi-select issues and drag them into an epic from the active sprint?
A: (/) Yes

Q: What if you multi-select issues from both the active sprint and from the backlog and drag to an epic?
A: (x) We can't do that, should we ?

Q: What if the epics panel is collapsed and you drag to it?
A: (/) Works the same way it would if it was open

Q: What happens when you drag to the edges of the screen?
A: (/) If there is non visible space it scrolls, nothing else

Q: What if the issues from the active sprint are already in another epic when you drag to a new one?
A: (/) The issue is affected to the new epic

Q: What if a quick/instant filter is on while dragging?
A: (/) Issues are filtered out and not selectable

Q: Any difference if the Epic is expanded or collapsed?
A: (/) No

fields.description:
Currently we have to query the change history according to the status name (as this was the only thing available in the index), which causes huge problems when a user renames a status or when a client anonymizes the change history data.

5.2 seems to also have stored/indexed by the status id, which would allow us to correctly load the status history even when status names changes.

Investigate to see whats possible
fields.summary: Status change history service should query by status id instead of name

fields.description:
When a user visits Plan Mode for the first time (i.e. their client side cache is cleared) they should be shown the "instructions" detail view.

Currently on default branch, this is not the case.

I think this has something to do with the url parameters being populated with these settings when switching to Plan Mode:

{code}
RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=7
    &view=planning.nodetail   // this should not be set?
{code}

fields.description:
1. Select issue 1, edit estimate
2. drag different issue and drop at new location.
-> issue does not exist error shows up

The problem seems to be a backlog reload, so the dragged issue ends up being invisible (the dom element might have gone away). so when dropping it can't find the id and boom...

fields.description:
This should offer similar functionality to the planning mode for the Scrum Boards as in [Using Plan Mode|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Using+Plan+Mode]. For example:

* Display and estimate.
* Organising via Epics.
* Column Done status.
* Swim lane and cell constraints.
fields.summary: As a Kanban PO I would like the Plan mode so that I may order and groom a large backlog

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As a user, I would like to specify a value which restricts the number of issues displayed in a column to that value and provides "pages" to cycle through excess issues.

This is similar to the "column constraints" setting, but without the side effect of changing colors -- the goal is to reduce the number of issues actually displayed and improve performance on lower-resource systems (like iPads) when > 30 issues are in a column.

fields.description: During discussions with a customer we discussed the option of asking for a comment when an issue is flagged so that you can understand what happened.
fields.summary: As a user, when flagging an issue I'd like to be asked for a comment

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As a Rapid Board configurer, 
I want to know that accidental Rapid Board deletions can be undone by administrators
So that I don't have to spend hours recreating my 12 project board with 20+ quick filters.

I'm floored that the only option is to restore the database to a previous backup.
Isn't the only time this table is searched (as opposed to {{WHERE ID=9}}) when we're in Manage Rapid Boards? That screen doesn't need to be super fast (not that adding a soft-delete flag would be slow anyhow).

In other words please make
{code}
UPDATE ..._RAPIDVIEW SET deleted=0 WHERE ID=9
{code}

an option (or some such thing)
fields.summary: Implement Rapid Board deletion as a soft delete

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently the rapid board implementation does not support all features the classic board does. Thus we decided not to use it at the moment.

Therefore we need a switch to either select the Classic or Rapid Board which can be set by the admin only.

h3. Workaround

# Stop JIRA.
# Install Java 6, as in [Installing Java|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Installing+Java].

fields.description:
FINAL BEHAVIOR:

1. For fields with options (epic status):
If everything is 1:1 like the original configuration, then lock the field, otherwise don't lock the field

1a. Unless there is all projects/appropriate issues field scheme with ZERO options in there. In that case we will just add the options.

1b. Unless there are no schemes, in which case we introduce our own.

2. For fields without option fix up the contexts then lock the field

3. do NOT fix up field names/descriptions for any of the fields

3a. But fix the searcher.

4. for the Rank field, change managed level to "admin" (field creation) plus a message that the field should normally not be created as GH creates the field

5. The default rank field should be fixed up in context and then locked.



In JIRA 5.2 there is a new API around Managed Configuration Items. This allows a plugin to specify that instances of custom fields, and custom field types, are "managed" by the plugin and should not be modified/created by administrators.

Fields to be restricted (no edit, no create):
All Issue Types/Global Context:
- Epic Link(show)
- Sprint(show)
- Rank(show)

Epics only/Global Context
- Epic Status(show)
- Epic Name(show/require/renderer - default text)
- Epic Color(show)

We must also ensure that existing fields are in the correct configuration before locking them down.

(!) Development Notes (!)

Q: Is fixVersions one of these since we rely on it for release planning?
A: (/) No - it is a system field provided by JIRA and therefore should be locked by definition.

Q: Rank field?
A: (/) Also fix/lock the default rank field
fields.summary: As a GH developer, I would like for the custom fields that GH creates to appear as "managed" in JIRA's administration interface

fields.description:
Step to reproduce:
# create 2 projects . TSTB and TSTC
# create mutiple issues for each project
# label one of the issue in project B with "DONE_BY_TSTC" . screenshot TSTB-1.png
# create Scrum board . Refer CreateBoard.png . Result is shown in Board1.png
# edit the Filter for this board to use 
{quote}
project = TSTC OR labels=DONE_BY_TSTC ORDER BY Rank ASC
{quote}
refer to screenshot FilterTab1.png and Filter1.png and ProblemFilter.png
# go to Agile tab, the sprint is not editable. refer to screenshot SprintProblem.png

Basically, when the filter returning issues which are not included in the project board, the sprint is not editable.


To workaround this problem, edit the board filter and use:
{quote}
project = TSTC OR (project in (TSTB) AND labels=DONE_BY_TSTC) ORDER BY Rank ASC
{quote}
Refer to screenshot WorkaroundFilter.png

fields.description:
We operate in sprints where we are often picking up 10+ stories, and our scrum process includes breaking those into subtasks, which often results in 20+ stories on the board.  We use a digital wall board to display our task board using the Wallboard gadget.  This gadget does not make good use of screen space, using up the entire width of a column for a story.

Using the classic wallboard, it was still slightly painful as we had to zoom/unzoom the wallboard to make things fit dynamically.  When you unzoomed, columns would fit multiple tasks into one column making it more efficient.  Now, a wallboard needs to be zoomed out to the point where you cannot read it in order to properly visualize every task.


Possible resolutions might be:

- Support side-by-side task visualization within each column
- Dynamically size the wallboard to fit all active tasks
- Dynamically size the columns so they don't use 1/3 or 1/4 of the screen when they're empty
- Visualize subtasks as smaller items so they don't take as much real estate

With swimlanes enabled for stories, things are even worse.
fields.summary: GreenHopper wallboard does not visualize many items on one screen nicely

* At least an issue need to be inside the sprint e.g. sprint A.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-6129].
  {panel}

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Supported+Platforms

The requirements for the latest stable release of jira (on premises) state that it works with JRE 1.6 and 1.7
According to the installation notes on your website, greenhopper 6.0.4 is supposed to work with the latest version of JIRA.
I tried to install greenhopper on top of the latest stable release of jira (on premises) with Sun JRE 1.7 update 7, but couldnt activate.
The error message was quite unhelpful, telling me there was a problem contacting the jira server, there was a problem with the license etc.
There was an indication to check the log files, but nowhere is the location of these files disclosed. 
I had to snoop around for quite some time and eventually found a line in a log file indicating a module used by greenhopper needed to be a particalur version which research lead me to find this meant JRE 1.6 was required.
After installing JRE 1.6 greenhopper works.
For the sake of keeping your customers happy, I strongly advise that you
* correct the documentation for greenhopper installation to include the proper requirements for a successful installation (a greenhopper problem)
* provide some indication of log file location from the user interface (a jira problem)
* provide better module error messages (a jira problem)
fields.summary: Support Platforms/Installation Requirements don't Mention GH is Incompatible with JRE 1.7

fields.description:
It's hard to reproduce this problem - a customer had somehow mapped the same status twice into the one column (possibly two users configuring at the same time?).

Regardless, the PUT request to update the column mapping is not correctly handling errors in a number of ways:
* The server side is not producing the expected response when there is an error - a 200 response was given despite errors being returned
* The server side is building its response in the "old" way instead of the "JIRA REST Format" way
* The PUT request from the client is not set up to handle errors in any specific way - this is only an issue because we are not constructing our error response appropriately.
fields.summary: Validation errors when updating column mappings are not handled correctly on client side
